would have gone to two years old but had to start medication that was absorbed in breast milk am totally for long term breast feeding though my personal opinion is two is long enough but really in an ideal world it would be mutual decision between baby and mom the who recommends up to two years and beyond which to me outweighs the ew that weird opinions of some http www who int topics breastfeeding en nursed my firstborn to 20 or 21 months would have let him wean on his own if had become pregnant again and developed huge nipple sensitivity that made it excruciating in my view after the first important year why not continue as long as it is positive relationship for mother and child nutritional benefits do magically disappear as for teeth my reaction to the first few bites made my little guy stop as soon as he started some babies get teeth early mine had few at few months old and by months not much of biter though my plan is to nurse in the evenings and have daycare offer homo milk during the day as go back to work when baby is year old some moms give me dirty looks for trying to night wean some relatives think insane for going beyond mo give zero fucks also babies age super gradually so find it weird to think that at certain age baby is cut off but that age minus day she is you also have to give your boobies time to adjust to making less milk my first feeling was ew but it was just an irrational reaction to something that unusual at least in the uk where from my son 11 months now and do think ll stop until at least two hope he ll wean naturally by about if not going to do do offer do refuse but not force the issue unless there good reason the process of breastfeeding has taught me what great bonding and comforting tool breastfeeding is as well as providing the ideal nutrition for babies nurse my baby to sleep and he night nurses and this is the one area might want to forcibly cut back on do regret doing it up till now but after year when he no longer needs the food over night think love to have my bed back and be able to pass nighttimes over to my husband once in while my plan is to do it for year minimum but may shoot for two years if that weirds you out you can always pump my baby is months and like to nurse him until he around two because of the health benefits nurse in the mornings and evenings and have him on regular food and cow milk during the day people like to say if they re old enough to ask for it they re too old to have it the best response to this is to do whatever the hell you want also the people who criticize nursing toddlers are often the same people who think you should give solids to month old that is they re not exactly up on the latest pediatric science when was pregnant thought nurse discreetly in public with nursing cover and at weeks said screw it and started nursing openly once established the relationship and rhythm with my son and saw how my milk was making him grow stopped caring if anyone saw my breast good luck see lactation consultant several times if necessary and do give up in the first month it worth sticking with it my only issue with it being used as comforting tool was that ve seen kids have tantrums at years old over not being allowed breast milk and it just causes more upset weaning at later age than when they are younger curious are you night weaning so dad can feed the baby at night edit wait your baby is older do these moms think your baby still needs to eat in the middle of the night my year old is nursing as write this today is an exception he extra clingy due to growth spurt but usually we nurse at nap and bedtime the benefits to his immune system and nutrition have been enormous he happy and secure so total win we re long past the stage of public nursing but those who know are hugely supportive even the ones who weaned at year we have had any direct negative feedback although people have dissed it in theory the teeth were really an issue for us plus he got them around 6mo lem me tell you when dealing with picky eaters it nice to have guaranteed source of nutrition there was great blog posted on this topic while back ll try to find it when not on my phone ** edit here the link http thelippylactator wordpress com 2013 04 29 can of worms note from the mother behind the motherwise photo controversy was looking for ** think that like everything depends on the child have seen great success with parents who wait for the communication that comes with being bit older to ease the transition but surely if they re truly quite young they do understand or are significantly bothered by the transition at what age would you be intending stop here in the uk the nhs advises you begin weaning at months there such mixed information could imagine nursing year old know everyone mentions the health benefits to doing so but my child is no longer breast fed and she is perfectly healthy really it all comes down to each their own my child is formula fed and eating solids like pro but that might not be what others would do with theirs the lack of understanding is what think drives some people to wait because they want to be able to explain their reasons for taking that comfort away as for not being bothered promise you that babies of all stages are very easily bothered by lot of things and are very vocal about it especially when it comes to mama boobies no judgement on right or wrong timing just perspective think the term weaning used by the nhs means the introduction of solids hate the teeth argument some babies get teeth very early if you were meant to stop when they got teeth then they should be ready to only eat solids right people would have switched to bottles once child got tooth before formula this is relatively new thing babies are going to start chewing away on your nipples as soon as they sprout teeth it actually quite simple to teach an infant not to bite my daughter is 16 months old and still nursing fairly often plan to continue until at least and beyond if she wants to feel it is personal decision for each family and hope the decision is based upon legitimate reasons not the pressure from outside entities the most effective one is over support of the head baby that is latched on can not bite when you over support the head the baby ca migrate down the nipple to the point of being able to effectively bite so when the baby is done nursing you stick your pinky finger into the corner of his her mouth and safely unlatch the baby rather than the baby squirming down and biting my daughter does like that so she stopped biting pretty quickly and no longer have to nurse her like that note do over support struggling baby if the baby does want to nurse like that do push the issue try other things instead and do do this with young baby because supporting young baby head causes them to pull back from the breast head support for young breastfeeding infant should be done closer to the base of the head
